page.title: 09St.Audries
page.content: The{Village of West Quantoxhead}is often known as{St. Audries.} West Quantoxhead is obviously referring to its{geographical location.}Its other name seems to derive from the dedication of the Church. The Church is that of{St. Ethelreda}who,was apparently, also known as St. Audrey. John Norton, the{Victorian {architect,}avoided most of the pseudo Gothic pitfalls so beloved of many of his contemporaries when he rebuilt the Church in the 1850's. The{original Church}had become quite beyond repair during the nineteenth century. The only things that could be{salvaged}were two of the {bells}that date back to the Fifteenth Century and the{Norman Font.} In addition the{fifteenth century screen was saved and in l930 was erected in Exford Church.
